abstract: Pres Obama and King Salman of Saudi Arabia, after months of disagreements, appear to put differences behind them during White House meeting; issue joint statement after session announcing king's support over Iran nuclear deal and his vow to aid American antiterrorism efforts.
lead_paragraph: At the beginning of their meetings at the White House, the two leaders stressed a long history of cooperation and friendship between their nations.

headline.main: Obama and Saudi King Sidestep Dispute Over Iran Nuclear Deal
headline.print_headline: After White House Visit, Saudi Backs Iran Deal

snippet: At the beginning of their meetings at the White House, the two leaders stressed a long history of cooperation and friendship between their nations.
